name: eeriness
content:

the quality of being strange in a frightening and mysterious way: The film captures the spectacular eeriness of the scenery and landscape. There is an eeriness about this remote and little-visited place. See
eerie
More examplesFewer examplesThere's something very compelling about the sweetness of her voice with the eeriness of the song. Adding to the eeriness is that 16 years after the earthquake, most of the city centre remains vacant. To embellish the eeriness of the tune, the song's intro rolls on for four minutes before Gibbard's chilly, plaintive vocals fall in.
